com.nokia.examples
Class TagFileManager

java.lang.Object
  com.nokia.examples.TagFileManager

public class TagFileManager
extends java.lang.Object

Stores and loads tag information from files.

Author:
Andreas Jakl

Field Detail

preferredDrive

private static final java.lang.String preferredDrive
If this drive is available, store the logs on this drive. Otherwise use the first drive available.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

nfcDir

private static final java.lang.String nfcDir
Default directory on the drive to store the files. Will be created if it doesn't exist beforehand.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

fileExt

private static final java.lang.String fileExt
File extension of the log files.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TagFileManager

public TagFileManager()
Method Detail

logTagInfo

public static java.lang.String logTagInfo(java.lang.String tagType,
                                          byte[] tagData)
Log information about the tag to a file. The file name will be selected automatically.

Parameters:
tagType - Class name of the tag type implementation. Will be added to the file name - everything after the last "." in the name.
tagData - Raw tag data to write into the log file.
Returns:
Drive, directory and filename of the created log file if successful. Doesn't include "file:///". Error message if unsuccessful.

getNewestNfcFile

public static java.lang.String getNewestNfcFile()
Search the data directory and return the newest (= last) file found.

Returns:
Filename of the last file in the data directory.

readFile

public static byte[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Read a data file and return its contents.

Parameters:
fileName - file to open, searched for in the default data directory.
Returns:
contents of the file as a byte array, null if unsuccessful.

ensureTwoCharNumber

private static java.lang.String ensureTwoCharNumber(int num)
Return the number as a String with at least two characters. For example, "4" would be returned as "04". "12" remains as "12".

Parameters:
num - number to convert to a 2-character string.
Returns:
String based on the number, at least two characters.

nfcDir

public static java.lang.String nfcDir()
Get the default data directory. Will use the preferred drive if available, otherwise the first (default) drive. Data directory name can be defined through the member variables.

Returns:
drive and directory of the data directory. Doesn't contain "file:///" designator.
